sources.title: A Blonde for a Night
sources.description: “An amusing farce” “As fluffy as Marie’s hair” (IMDB reviews quotes). A breezy marital comedy in which newlywed Marie Prevost tests her husband’s fidelity by disguising herself with a blonde wig. This completely fools everybody. (Yeah I know. It’s really far-fetched.) Good cast and good production values. So suspend your power of disbelief and have fun. IMDB 6.5. Directed by E Mason Hopper and F McGrew Willis. Released in 1920. Complete print?

metadata.Plot: After an argument, a newlywed decides to test her husband's fidelity by disguising herself as a blonde.
metadata.Director: E. Mason Hopper, F. McGrew Willis
metadata.Writer: Betty Browne, Wilson Collison, John W. Krafft
metadata.Actors: Marie Prevost, Franklin Pangborn, Harrison Ford
